comments.commentBody: Trump's logic: Barack Obama learned from Islamic terrorists how to tap phones big league in the Trump Tower secretly while rigging the election  when he was at his birthplace in Kenya.
Yes.  Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...Russia...and, y'know, Russia!

"Projection is a psychological defense mechanism in which individuals attribute characteristics they find unacceptable in themselves to another person. ... In some cases projection can result in false accusations." This is classic protectionism, calling Obama a "bad or sick" guy. The best defense is a good offense, even if the offense is based on total falsehoods. Investigators: Keep the focus on Russia.

Aaaand...still waiting for the GOP to show some spine. Good thing I'm not holding my breath. Almost every one of them is silent and thus complicit, either for political advancement or lack of courage--and both reasons make me ill. Apparently the stakes aren't high enough yet, eh, Mister Speaker?

1. Obama is a private citizen so Trump's assertions about criminal actions might be actionable libel.  If anyone knows that it is Trump.  2.  Trump was a rotten kid before his father had to send him to military school to straighten him out and before Roy Cohn mentored him.  Rotten kids become rotten adults as personalities are formed very young.  3.  Sundowning can happen any time but particularly upon arising when what has been dreamed or thought about tends to confuse and disorient.  There seems to be no serious discussion of the pathology of Trump's behavior, just astonishment, but it is necessary to consider as real possibility.

Back in the 60's, this behavior would have been attributed to " bad drugs ".
Now, in this case, I think it's LACK of drugs, or inadequate dosing. So sad.
Time for an intervention? But by whom? The entire inner circle seems to be equally as delusional.
Really?? Probably not true but they should round people up anyway??

Trump's tweets are nothing but a "ploy" A ploy that diverted the news from the AG, Russian probe and Putin to fake, unproven Obama accusations. Trump knows how to play and manipulate the media 'like a fiddle'....works every time.
While the media headlined fake stuff and the culprits an escape into the background
It's embarrassing the president misspelled "tap" as "tapp". But a far more sign that he is distracting from the Russian investigation. Keep focused.
Good post. I wish he were simply in the garage and bothering the neighbors!

Does Trump really want even more speculation about what he or his associates have been up to? Maybe his penthouse has been tapped -- by Russia. Among his associates who have at times had offices in Trump Tower are Roger Stone and Felix Sater. The Alfa Bank server is an interesting connection.

Maybe there should be a complete inspection of Trump Tower to see who is spying on who. I suspect the outcome will not be to Trump's benefit.

No one seriously believes that President Obama, a constitutional law expert, would resort to these kinds of tactics. But Trump has been associated with many unsavory people across the years. No doubt he has invited a number of them to meet with him at Trump Tower. They could have left behind surveillance equipment. that would include Ambassador Kislyak who met with Jared Kushner and Michael Flynn in December 2016 in Trump Tower, a secret meeting until recently exposed by the Times.

The plot thickens.
It sounds like another one of Trump's delusional episodes.  Doesn't he realize medications are available to decrease those episodes?  Isn't his family concerned?

I have held my tongue since November 8, I shall do so no longer. It's time for the men in the white coats to head over to 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue, and to take President Donald J. Trump to a mental institution. The man is a danger to himself, and more importantly this nation, a fact that grows more obvious by the day.
For the longest time during the campaign, I truly believed that Donald was just putting on a show. Telling the great unwashed masses what they wanted to hear, only to go back stage and laugh with his cronies that the crowds were eating his swill.
However I've come to realize that Donald's dangerously mentally unbalanced and he has at best a tenuous grip on reality. He is a clear and present danger to our country and the time has come to remove him from power and for Mike Pence to take over.
Although I shudder to think what this nation will be like after four-years of a Pence Presidency, I've got no doubts that the Vice President's mentally stable. Donald's statements and actions have proven to me that he's delusional. He seems to be unable to grasp that as POTUS, every word he utters has import and that he can't just throw out totally unsubstantiated charges on a whim.
The fate of the planet is now in the hands of a man that sees enemies behind every bush and lamp post, yet he yearns to be BFF with a murdering despot. Trying to disparage former President Obama, without a scintilla of evidence, shows just how demented this poor man truly is. SAD

What is most terrifying is that Mr. Sack's comments are not hyperbole. This is not political partisanship, Whitehouse intrigue, gossip, spin or any of the other actions and behaviours which have been part of U.S. politics since the republic was formed. First, Donald Trump is a clear and present danger to his country and mine for all the reasons we are all to familiar with. I am not, typically, invested in which flavour of government our neighbour installs. Like us, they come and go; left and right in turn. Consider this truth however. The world has no idea what the U.S. is, as a nation, anymore. There is fear across the globe. Second, civil unrest should be a very real concern to the U.S. Government (capital G). The division, mistrust and entrenched ideologies of the public could create unmanageable unrest for your country.

It is time for the Ms. Check and Mr. Balance to prepare to move quickly in whatever way and whatever direction is legal and necessary to stabilize America.

Is it possible we could use a little common sense. President Obama spent eight years in the White House without a hint of scandal, although under the watchful eye of his opponents. Does anyone with a slither of common sense seriously think he would authorize an illegal wiretap (as if he would get a rogue group together with the expertise to do it) and destroy his legacy?
Clearly then something is amiss. Either the FISA court issued a warrant, which indicates some suspicion of wrong doing or our current President is either complete ignoramus or arguably insane. Either way, he and his keepers are going to eventually have some "splaining" to do!

The media falls into Trump traps every time he decides to change the news cycle. In what universe is a tweet with unproven accusations front page news?  In Trump's universe, he changes the national discussion on a whim. When will the media wise up to it?
Several NY Times articles have detailed information collected on Trump associates by "wire taps". Do you all really think Obama had nothing to do with this ?

Well, Obama should definitely do more than just claim the accusation is "false."  I'm so disappointed in Obama... he has a platform like few others in this country, yet he is failing to use it as the patriot I believe him to be.  I'd love Obama to step up and call it what it is... the ranting of a madman, and a diversion from more important issues like Trump's ties to Russia.  That would get attention.

All GOP, repeat after me:

Trump Don John is the kindest, bravest, warmest, most wonderful human being I've ever known in my life.

Now help yourselves to more Kool-Aid.

I suggest someone be well paid, and with all expenses, to follow him around everywhere  Whenever he comes out in public that person should be standing outside Trump Tower, the White House, Mar-a-Lago, everywhere - dressed in a white uniform and holding a large butterfly net.  We need to gaslight him over the edge.

"But a senior White House official said that Donald F. McGahn II, the president’s chief counsel, was working on Saturday to secure access to what Mr. McGahn believed was an order issued by the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court authorizing some form of surveillance related to Mr. Trump and his associates."

He was probably ordered to, and God help him if he returns empty handed. This reminds me of a story about "Flynn Facts," based on the habit of the former security official to just make a wild assertion and then order his staff to find the evidence.

The very fact that Trump is getting angrier and angrier about the Russia story just convinces me more and more, with each successive outburst, that there really is a LOT to this story.

If Trump has nothing to hide, he should welcome with open arms every single investigation allegedly being pursued across multiple intelligence agencies.

So why doesn't he?
Me too.

One qualm: there were unlikely disgruntled insiders sabotaging NK's missile testing. Have you not been what happened to people who crossed, real or imaginary, the little dictator? People there may be extremely unhappy but they are unlikely risking their lives for something they deem no benefit to them.

With regard to the U.S.'s action going forward, it is chilling just to think about people like them and Putin have access to MWD of any kind. Recently, a CEO said something rather strange at the quarterly conference call. He said something like he is not sure if there is another year - and people don't think he was referring to his own company

Re: " how dare...... Kellyanne Conway perch so flippantly on an Oval Office couch...."
What I saw was K. Conway squatting on the couch in a skirt with her knees inches apart. It wasn't the couch part that offended my eye but the lack of decorum with legs apart while wearing a skirt. She's more than old enough to know better.

A lady does not put her feet up on the couch, and she sits with her knees together. A lady is all about decorum and showing respect, not just for herself, but for the people around her. While this kind of behavior might be considered acceptable at a slumber party held by teenage girls, it is not considered ladylike or respectable for women over 20, especially in a room full of men in suits.

@Jackie: wow, a piece of real pre-feminist pearl-clutching!

"A lady will or won't do....what now?"

Come on! I am 61, and when I was a kid, "ladies" wore hats and gloves, girdles even if very slender ("because of potential jiggle"), slips under every dress no matter the weather -- stockings in all weather -- and certainly would not show their knees! very immodest.

Only that was 55-60 years ago. Did you think Hillary was "unladylike" for wearing pantsuits?

Yeesh! when did liberals become "pearl clutchers" anyways?

@Charles Hayman ~ Wow! What an angry reply to my comment. If you watch the video of KC on the couch, it's obvious that anyone standing in front of her could have seen all the way to that place that djt brags about grabbing. BTW, she didn't need to be on the couch to get good photographs.
You're correct I don't like her. Correction I can't stand her.
If you were aware of my political positions, you would not attack and accuse me of wanting to go back to the fifties. And pantsuits, which I do like, became popular attire for women in the mid-60's.
Not everyone raved about the speech.  Some of us recognized it as the same old empty nonsense at a lower aural level.
